text: Your Tuesday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
The Book Review PodcastBrian Stelter on “Hoax”; Reed Hastings on Netflix.
Listen to ‘The Daily’A deadly tinderbox.

Leaders in Oregon, California and Washington State are pleading for help. Tens of thousands of people have been displaced and at least 27 are dead.A shroud of smoke has grounded flights, canceled classes and smothered neighborhoods with some of the dirtiest air on the planet. Here’s the latest.
A fire destroyed much of Phoenix, Ore., leaving people to wonder whether it can rise from the ashes. “There’s nothing to sift through,” one resident said.
Rush Limbaugh and Tucker Carlson dismiss scientists’ determination that climate change is a key culprit in West Coast wildfires.

Trump Health Official Apologizes for Facebook OutburstMichael Caputo, the assistant secretary of health for public affairs, is considering a medical leave after he accused federal scientists of “sedition.”

LIVEAs Cases Rise, Europe Enters ‘Living-With-the-Virus Phase’Europe’s approach contrasts sharply to the U.S., where restrictions to protect against the virus have been politically divisive. Here’s the latest.
Documents Reveal How the Police Kept Daniel Prude’s Death QuietOfficials in Rochester, N.Y., spent months trying to suppress video footage of the police encounter that led to Mr. Prude’s death.
Breonna Taylor’s mother, Tamika Palmer, left, during a news conference in Louisville, Ky., on Tuesday. Bryan Woolston/Reuters
LIVEWe’re tracking the Delaware primary results here.

President Trump preparing to deliver remarks with the prime minister of Israel and the foreign affairs ministers of Bahrain and the United Arab Emirates at the White House on Tuesday. Doug Mills/The New York Times
Justice Dept. Opens Criminal Inquiry Into John Bolton’s BookInvestigators are examining whether the former national security adviser illegally disclosed classified information.
